verses.kjv: Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have free course, and be glorified, even as it is with you:
verses.ct: Finally, brothers and sisters, pray for us — that the Lord's message will spread rapidly and be honored, just as it has been among you.

verses.kjv: And that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men: for all men have not faith.
verses.ct: Also pray that we will be rescued from twisted and evil people, because not everyone has faith.

verses.kjv: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
verses.ct: But the Lord is faithful, and he will strengthen you and protect you from the evil one.

verses.kjv: And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.
verses.ct: We have confidence in the Lord regarding you — that you are doing and will continue to do what we instruct you.

verses.kjv: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.
verses.ct: May the Lord guide your hearts toward the love of God and the endurance that comes from Christ.

verses.kjv: Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly, and not after the tradition which he received of us.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, we instruct you in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to stay away from any believer who lives an undisciplined life and doesn't follow the teaching they received from us.

verses.kjv: For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;
verses.ct: You already know that you should follow our example, because we didn't live in an undisciplined way when we were with you.

verses.kjv: Neither did we eat any man’s bread for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we might not be chargeable to any of you:
verses.ct: We never ate anyone's food without paying for it. Instead, we worked hard, laboring day and night so that we wouldn't be a financial burden on any of you.

verses.kjv: Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.
verses.ct: It's not that we didn't have the right to ask for support, but we wanted to set an example for you to follow.

verses.kjv: For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.
verses.ct: Even when we were with you, we gave you this rule: if someone refuses to work, they shouldn't eat.

verses.kjv: For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies.
verses.ct: We say this because we've heard that some among you are living undisciplined lives — not doing any work at all, but instead meddling in other people's business.

verses.kjv: Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.
verses.ct: To those people, we give this instruction and urge them through our Lord Jesus Christ: settle down, do your work, and earn your own living.

verses.kjv: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.
verses.ct: As for the rest of you, brothers and sisters, never get tired of doing what is right.

verses.kjv: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.
verses.ct: If anyone doesn't obey what we've said in this letter, take note of that person and don't associate with them, so that they will feel ashamed.

verses.kjv: Yet count him not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.
verses.ct: But don't treat them as an enemy — instead, warn them as you would a brother.

verses.kjv: Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.
verses.ct: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times and in every situation. May the Lord be with all of you.

verses.kjv: The salutation of Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every epistle: so I write.
verses.ct: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand. This is the distinguishing mark in all my letters — this is how I write.

verses.kjv: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verses.ct: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you. Amen.
